packagecontents: An MC400 LTE Modem (Included with AER1600LP3. Optional for AER1600, and AER1600LPE.)
A Safety, Regulatory, and Warranty Guide
getConnect:
Connecting a wired wan

Connect your Ethernet WAN source to the WAN port of the AER1600 (Port WAN is default WAN. All ports are LAN/WAN switchable).
insertSim:
Insert an Activated SIM


If setting up cellular connectivity, do the following:
 

  1. Turn the router over and remove the screw to the SIM door.
  1. Lift the SIM 1 card slot and insert an activated 2FF-sized SIM card. Insert the notch end first with the metal contacts facing the interior of the device when the SIM door is closed.
  1. Insert a second activated SIM card into the SIM 2 card slot, if desired.



 

Insert Optional External MC400 Modem


The AER1600 Series has a slot for a removable modular MC400. To install this modem, do the following:
 

  1. Insert an activated 2FF-sized SIM card into the MC400 modem, metal contacts down, notch end first.
  1. Remove the modem door on the AER1600 Series device.
  1. Slide the MC400 modem into the available modem into the available modem slot, USB plug first, with the Cradlepoint logo facing up.
 
  1. Replace the MC400 modem door cover.NOTE:  Remove the plastic SMA covers from the modem door cover for the additional antenna ports on the modem.
  1. Secure the door cover screw (beneath the device).
    NOTE:  The modem door cover must be on the device or the embedded modem will not power on.
attachAnttena:
Attach the Antennas

Attach the two or four (depending on model) cellular modem antennas (included) to the connectors.

NOTE: The WiFi Antennas on the AER1600 are internal to the device.

  1. Hold the antenna straight and twist the base of the antenna to connect to the device.
    • Do not over-tighten. The maximum recommended torque is 4 in-lbs.

  1. Angle the antennas for optimal signal reception.
poweron:
Connect the Power Source

  1. Connect the power supply to the router and then plug the other end into an electrical outlet.
  2. Switch the device to ON (O = OFF, â€“ = ON). The LED lights will begin lighting up.
